title: Distressed bear wails as it's tethered to fence beside circus advert
text:

A distressed black bear is seen wailing as its tethered to a fence beside a circus advert in Russia.

The animal is seen crying out as it is forced to stand on its hind legs in the horrifying footage taken in the gold-mining town of Bodaybo.

The video has led to huge protests across the world but local official Elena Stepanova, head of the town’s culture department, laughed it off and said the bear was behaving like a "little girl."

One protester wrote: "This little bear is crying, he is not happy and another said : “People, wake up, what are you doing?”

(Image: The Siberian Times)

(Image: The Siberian Times)

“This is pure cruelty and circuses should be banned,” said another.

People claimed the animal was “hungry” or “injured” after watching the footage.

But local official Ms Stepanova defended the travelling circus and its performing wild animals.

She even claimed the animal was “singing", denying it was in distress.

(Image: The Siberian Times)

(Image: The Siberian Times)

Stepanova claimed children had been delighted by the circus show and the several bears in the show - including this one were “cheerful”.

Circus director Evgeny Zakharov claimed the “unusual” bear was “talking”.

"I did not think that this video would cause so much negativity,” he said.

“At that moment, a trainer was nearby, about to give the bear sausages.”
description: The crying animal was tethered on its hind legs next to an advert for a travelling circus in Russian gold-mining town Bodaybo
